description: Comprehensive training dataset for conditional logic (q:if/q:else/q:elseif)

conditional_types.simple_if: ✅ Fully covered (3 basic + usage in complex examples)
conditional_types.if_else: ✅ Fully covered (3 basic + nested + ui patterns)
conditional_types.if_elseif_else: ✅ Fully covered (3 basic + business logic + validation)

logical_operators.AND: ✅ ADDED (5 examples: multiple conditions, range checks, validation)
logical_operators.OR: ✅ ADDED (3 examples: role checks, fallback logic)

integration_patterns.conditional_loops: ✅ ADDED (5 examples: conditional loop execution, filtering, zebra striping)
integration_patterns.ui_rendering: ✅ ADDED (6 examples: loading states, auth menus, empty states, alerts, feature flags, responsive)
integration_patterns.business_logic: ✅ ADDED (6 examples: pricing, shipping, membership, RBAC, inventory, credit)
integration_patterns.form_validation: ✅ ADDED (4 examples: email, password, age, required fields)

training_readiness.notes: Comprehensive coverage of conditional patterns with 39 positive examples showing multiple implementation styles. Covers basic, intermediate, and advanced use cases including nested logic, complex boolean expressions, UI rendering patterns, and business logic scenarios.
recommended_additions: Switch/case pattern examples (if feature is implemented)
Performance optimization patterns for complex conditionals

positive: positive/business_logic.json (6 examples) - Business rules and pricing
negative: negative/invalid_syntax.json (5 examples) - Common errors and validation

usage_instructions.for_llm_training: Use positive examples for code generation training. Show LLM multiple ways to solve same problem (e.g., filtering can use nested if vs complex AND expression). Negative examples teach error detection and validation.
usage_instructions.for_developers: Reference these examples when learning q:if. See progression from basic to advanced. Real-world patterns show production usage.
usage_instructions.for_testing: Automated tests should mirror these examples. Each example represents a valid test case.

example_diversity.implementation_styles: Shows 3-6 different approaches per pattern type
example_diversity.use_cases: Form validation, UI rendering, business logic, RBAC, pricing, inventory, responsive design
example_diversity.multiple_solutions: Same problem solved different ways (e.g., validation via nested if vs AND operators)
